metadata.title: CVE-2024-56620 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:scsi: ufs: qcom: Only free platform MSIs when ESI is enabledOtherwise, it will result in a NULL pointer dereference as below:Unable to handle kernel NULL pointer dereference at virtual address0000000000000008Call trace: mutex_lock+0xc/0x54 platform_device_msi_free_irqs_all+0x14/0x20 ufs_qcom_remove+0x34/0x48 [ufs_qcom] platform_remove+0x28/0x44 device_remove+0x4c/0x80 device_release_driver_internal+0xd8/0x178 driver_detach+0x50/0x9c bus_remove_driver+0x6c/0xbc driver_unregister+0x30/0x60 platform_driver_unregister+0x14/0x20 ufs_qcom_pltform_exit+0x18/0xb94 [ufs_qcom] __arm64_sys_delete_module+0x180/0x260 invoke_syscall+0x44/0x100 el0_svc_common.constprop.0+0xc0/0xe0 do_el0_svc+0x1c/0x28 el0_svc+0x34/0xdc el0t_64_sync_handler+0xc0/0xc4 el0t_64_sync+0x190/0x194

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-56620` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-199-generic - 3.13.0-173.224
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-199-lowlatency - 3.13.0-173.224
Available with Ubuntu Pro with Legacy support add-on: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-258-generic - 4.4.0-164.192~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-258-generic - 4.4.0-164.192~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-258-lowlatency - 4.4.0-164.192~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro with Legacy support add-on: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1135-aws - 4.4.0-1054.58
Available with Ubuntu Pro with Legacy support add-on: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1180-azure - 4.15.0-1059.64~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro with Legacy support add-on: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-173.224').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-164.192~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1054.58').
linux-azure package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1059.64~14.04.1').
